head.supplied: ¶ Laid before the zoological Committee and ordered to be acknowledged with the Committees gratitude. ¶ Ferd. Mueller ¶ ¶ 3/10/60....

div.p: P60/8024, unit 843, VPRS 1189/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

See also J. Moore to M, 1 February 1859.
On 8 December 1858 J. Tootal, London wrote to the Chief Secretary, Melbourne, J. O'Shanassy, suggesting Victoria needed two pure alpaca bucks and offering to acquire them on behalf of the Government. O'Shanassy deemed that there were not funds for the purchase available and that pending the result of M's application for a loan of two bucks from NSW, the Alpaca Fund Committee could be approached about the purchase.
On 5 September 1860 the Secretary of the Public Lands Department, Sydney informed the Chief Secretary, W. Nicholson, that Victoria could borrow two male alpacas as requested. The Under Secretary, J. Moore, referred this letter to the Committee of Management of the Zoological Gardens. It was laid before the Committee on 3 October (Unit 2, VPRS 2223, PROV).
Laid before the zoological Committee and ordered to be acknowledged with the Committees gratitude.

div.p:
3/10/60.
See also M to J. Moore, 5 November 1860.
